div.title: smith vocational and agricultural High School

span.span: Under the direction of Governor Baker, the Smith Vocational and Agricultural High School campus is closed through May 4th, 2020. We will continually evaluate the situation and take appropriate guidance from the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, the City of Northampton, and the Department of Public Health.

Staff will be available in the main office and the District Administrative Office (the Whitehouse) from 9 am to 1 pm Monday through Thursday. We request, based on the directives from Governor Baker and Mayor Narkewicz, that any inquiries be made by phone or email.

Grab and Go will be available Starting Wednesday, March 18, 2020, Smith Vocational and Agricultural High School will provide an opportunity for families with food insecurities to pick up, at no cost, breakfast, and lunch for children under the age of 18. The meals will be available for pick up via a drive-thru service at our school.
This program will occur on Mondays and Wednesdays from 11am – 1pm in the schools’ parking lot between A Building and D Building. Please stay in your vehicle and meals will be passed to you.
Celebrating over 110 years of Vocational and Agricultural Education!
“Our job is to open as many doors for our students as possible” - Superintendent Dr. Linkenhoker
Schedule a visit and apply online
"Students take a full range of academic courses, they are then able to apply that book knowledge to real-world knowledge."
